name: Residenza di Ripetta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is excellent, right in the centre and in walking distance of everything. Our room ( nr 105 ) was surprisingly spacious and very warm although outside was close to 0 degrees.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay! Will definitely return!

reviews.text: Great breakfast - the buffet was always full whether you went there at 7 or near closing time!
reviews.title: Great aparthotel in very central location

reviews.text: Very helpful and polite staff - especially at the reception. They even let us stay until 17:00 without charging us, even though check out time was at 10:30 in the morning. It was certainly comforting for us to find out that some hotels will still go that extra mile to keep the customer satisfied!
reviews.title: we love this hotel ,makes our trip better!!!!

reviews.text: This hotel has a lot of good facilities and a good breakfast. But please beware of the gypsies (also known as pickpockets) that surround the hotel. I advise you try not to go to the city and trains. If you do, you would prefer to have a lock for every important thing you have near to your body.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but when you see the main website you will be tricked by the picture in the top

reviews.text: we have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. We were with our 14 year old son. The room was really spacious and on 2 levels which gave us all some privacy during the stay. It was like a small apartment with dining table and basic kitchen facilities if you want t eat in - which we didn't - I was on holiday too! The breakfast is described as " American" so my son expected pancakes and waffles which were not on offer ( so he stayed in bed after the first morning) but a good selection of cereal, pastry goods, fruit, yoghurts and a hot selection were available. The table was constantly topped up right until the bitter end so everyone got the full choice.
reviews.title: highly recommended

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was very good. A couple of minutes from the metro providing liknks to all the major attractions but within 10 minutes walk of the spanish steps and trevi fountain.
reviews.title: great location for everything!

reviews.text: This was our first visit to Rome which we loved and will return soon. I will not hesitate to stay and this hotel again for its location, space and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Very good location, service, room size, cleanliness and breakfast! Star Service!
My stay at Ripetta's Residence Hotel
reviews.text: this is an ideal base for sightseeing we choose it because it was a three day trip with my mother and three young children.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at this hotel for one night (thank heavens only one) after a cruise and before our departure back to Australia. When we arrived it was a construction site. I think we were the only people on our floor and the entire floor was covered with cardboard boxes which make wheeling our suitcases very difficult. No one offered to help and we were left to find our own room. Somebody started using a vacuum cleaner outside our room at 9.30pm making it impossible to sleep, I rang reception and they stopped him only to have him start up again a few minutes later. The kitchen in our room didn't have any water connected to it so was useless. Breakfast was very average and they had run out of most things by the time we went down at 9.30. Catching a taxi was very difficult as they couldn't stop outside the hotel and we had to wait quite a while for one that would stop. This put a very sour note to the end of an otherwise fantastic trip.
reviews.title: Worst experience ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Rome for our honeymoon and we chose "Residenza di Ripetta" because of the reviews of Tripadvisor and the location. First of all as per the location was great and very close to almost everywhere.. But this was the only great thing about the hotel. When we first entered we faced a huge mess.. The hotel was under re-construction, there were workers everywhere who were painting all the walls around and making noise.. The employees there were everything but kind and helpful. No one knew if we were staying at the hotel, neither our room number etc. As per the rooms.. OMG! Awfull, just awfull! Broken walls, a blue dirty carpet (with chips on it), towels that were smelling like dead people and very very noisy plumping! All furniture were very old (probably since early 60's-70's) and a fantastic view to the workers outside..! No one ever informed us that the hotel would be under re-construction and when we sent an email before our arrival - just to confirm our room and reservation - they simply never answered us! So kind and helpful.. I would definetely never go to that place again and of course would NEVER recommend it to anyone else..! Very very... very BAD! So sad for such a historic place and building.. shame on them..
reviews.title: UNFORTUNATELY BAD...

reviews.text: P.S. We only rated the hotel for its location, which was really fantastic
reviews.title: Superb location, central but very quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel. Staff were always extremely helpful and pleasant. Good location right in the centre of Rome. Room clean and extremely quiet; however, our room had a very high window that was too high to see out of into the inner courtyard. We would definitely stay at the hotel again on our trips to Rome.
reviews.title: Centrally located, clean and comfortable hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Residenza di Ripetta for one week in the middle of August. The hotel is very conveniently located less than five minutes walk from the Piazza del Popolo and the Spanish Steps. We were able to walk to all the great sights of Rome, the Colosseum, the Vatican, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, the Jewish Ghetto, Trastevere, etc. We were welcomed by very helpful English speaking staff. Our rooms were very spacious - we travelled with our 20 year old son and both our rooms had a sitting area (with sofa bed) a dining table and chairs, a two ring hob and small sink, a large refrigerator, crockery, cutlery and pans so that we could "eat in" if we chose. The very large beds were firm but comfortable, the rooms were airconditioned and very peaceful - no traffic or any other noise! The hotel was in the process of some refurbishment whilst we were there and the rooms we had were certainly a little faded so maybe they are due for redecoration? The TV only had one English channel - BBC world news. There is an internet room for guests use in the lobby of the hotel. 5 euros for an hour or 10 euros for 24 hours. The breakfast buffet was generally good - fruit juices, fresh fruit, bacon, sausage, scrambled egg, cereals, pastries, bread rolls, cakes and hot drinks. Our only criticisms of the hotel would have to be that neither of our rooms had any view whatsoever - they looked out onto a rendered wall. If we were staying there again we would ask for a room with a view of the internal courtyard which was well tended and a nice place to sit, having chairs and tables with parasols. The other disappointment was that the roof terrace was rather neglected - much of the planting was dead or dying through lack of water and it seemed to us that it was a really useful space which could have been made much better use of by the hotel - a plunge pool would have been good and perhaps a bar or cafe - but there may not be sufficient demand? We also thought that the hotel bar/restaurant should have opened longer - it seemed to close by about 7.30 p.m. - we would certainly have gone into the bar for a "nightcap" had it been open when we got back into the hotel after dinner at one of the many local restaurants. The transfer time from the FCO airport was about 25 mins. by city taxi (white cars) which operate at a standard rate of 40 euros each way - don't get persuaded into another type of taxi at the airport (there are lots of touts) as it will cost you a lot more!!
reviews.title: Lacks style and charm but sleeps well

description: Right around the corner from Piazza del Popolo and the Spanish Steps is one of Rome’s most charming secret hideaways: Residenza di Ripetta. This oasis of peace and tranquility is nestled in one of the capital’s most famous former convents, a stunning 17th century structure that embraces a verdant inner courtyard.
